Reviews.Title: GREAT FOR GAMING
Reviews.Author: Yongari
Reviews.Content: After months of contemplating which LED TV made by my fellow Koreans I should purchase, I came across this gem one day. "DLP? LOL!" I thought. Little did I know that DLP technology improved drastically over the past decade.First off, this T.V. is gorgeous. The picture, once calibrated (make sure you go google some settings because out the box the picture is mediocre). At first I was a little disappointed, but after proper configuration, the T.V. looks as good as the Samsung LED we have in our other living room.Gaming wise, I popped in a bunch of xbox 360 games, and oh boy, the picture was great. No blur whatsoever. Don't be fooled by 120hz vs 240hz that LED's advertise. You won't even be able to tell. Not in the slightest. 60 to 120 there is a noticeable difference in gaming, but 120+ you really can't tell. Game consoles that output that many frames per second anyways.Halo 4 looks particularly amazing on this TV. When the master chief's arms and guns are life-size, you feel pretty awesome.Speakers are ok. Loud, but don't seem to balance sound very well. For example, in most games, voices seem not-quite-loud-enough while everything else (bullets, etc) sound very loud. Maybe I can adjust this.If you don't want to spend like $5000 on a 82 inch LED tv, this is the best bang for your buck. From the front, not one of my friends or neighbors were able to notice that this TV was not LED. Even from a diagonal angle, the TV is cleverly designed so that you can't see the back popping out at all. Everyone thinks the TV is a thin LED~

Reviews.Title: 92-inch is absolutely monstrous.
Reviews.Author: royalwalter3

} // ]]> var cv_mo1K1GSLK896VDCRollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo1K1GSLK896VDCRollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81-4l19XpiS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo1K1GSLK896VDCcurrentClick) { return cv_mo1K1GSLK896VDCcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 5:00 MinsI just bought the 92" from Aarons. It was right around the same price as it is on Amazon, just a few hundred more. They carried the TV into my house and set it up for me. Be warned: The TV is extremely heavy. It took 4 men to carry it off of their truck and into my house. It's easy to set up and the remote is really easy to figure out. Another warning: you need to sit at least ten feet away from the television so that the picture isn't blurry. It also needs to be on a stand because it doesn't have a wall mount. Another warning: it needs to lean against the wall because it's kind of tippy if it's not well supported. However, I left my dog alone with it in the bedroom for a few hours while I ran to the store. He loves to climb on things and jump up on them whenever possible. The TV was still standing just fine. If you go to the Aarons website and type in "TV Console", click on '72" TV Console'. That's the one that we got with our television. I'm not sure exactly how much it costs and I can't find it on Amazon. It hangs over a little bit on each side by about 6 inches. With this stand, it's approximately six feet tall. My wife is 5' 2" and when she stretches her arm up flatfoot, she barely reaches the top of it. Without the stand, it's about four and half feet tall. It's also pretty wide; about 8 feet. The television is a little over two feet wide, so when you're planning out the space of ten feet, make sure you take that into consideration. It is a lot of money for a television and I wouldn't recommend buying it if you need to move anytime soon. Before you choose to buy a television that large, make sure that there's plenty of room to put it.ONE MORE THING I RECENTLY FOUND OUT!!! Make sure you view the Mitsubishi website. On there, they have a list of authorized dealers. Amazon is an authorized dealer, however some of their resellers are not. On the website it states:"DON'T BE FOOLED! While Amazon is an authorized online retailer of Mitsubishi products, many resellers who sell on the Amazon marketplace are not. When purchasing, it is important to note where the product is being "shipped from and sold by," which is stated clearly in the header for each product on Amazon.com."Why does this matter? If you're not using an authorized dealer, there isn't a warranty with it. It's better to pay a few hundred more to have your TV under warranty. To find out if the place you're looking at buying your TV is authorized to sell it to you, type "Mitsubishi TV" into Google. The website will be "mitsubishi-tv dot com" You'll want to make sure the little hyphen is there. Click on the website. On the left hand side, navigate to "Retail Locator". When you click on that, you can either type in your zip code or click the gray box that says "See Online Retailers" on the right hand side. If you scroll down on the page that comes up for online retailers, they also show common unauthorized dealers, including ones from Amazon and eBay.UPDATE!!!Glad we bought the TV at Aarons. About a month ago, our stand broke. We called them and they came and replaced it with a new one for free. Our first one was wood, with beautiful doors, but the weight of the TV caused it to bow and the doors no longer closed.Today, 3/19/2013, the sound from our PS3 stopped working. I checked our Wii and the sound on that worked fine, but that uses AV cords. I checked the sound using a headset connected to the PS3 and that worked fine. I checked my XBox 360, and the sound on that, which is also HDMI, doesn't work either. Called someone and they'll be here on Thursday, 3/21/2013, to take a look.Update:As requested by many, instead of uploading just a picture of the television, I uploaded a video. The game on the screen is Call of Duty Black Ops 2. I don't own any of the rights to the game. I recorded the game using my Samsung Galaxy S3 cell phone. The colors look a lot better than they seem in the video. However, you'll want a dark room to play or watch in, because viewing can be hard otherwise.

Reviews.Title: WoW
Reviews.Author: vik
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from my old Philips 37 inches basic TV. The upgrade forme is huge. The size of 73 inches is just right for my living room. The picture quality is excellent. Even in bright daylight, I did not have any problems even with tons of windows in my living room. 3D is amazing - but the tv does not come with glasses.THe sound system is effective but for a fully immersive experience, I would suggest adding a surround sound system.TV does take a bit of time to start up (7-10 sec), but not a deal breaker. Another irritating thing is it takes time to change channels (using my comcast box), if the channels are in different HD format eg. 1080 vs 780. (in the process the screen remains black).TV is smart enough to remember your devices. Once a device is plugged in (say PS3), it will automatically switch to that input. Has other features of a regular TV (sleep, child lock, video adjustments, audio adjustments etc)The TV is big in size, and as others have mentioned, seems structurally weak. But I think the TV is strong enough for its size and purpose. Mine arrived from Arizona to PA without any problem.Comes with a good remote with big buttons - No problems there.For the price being offered here for this model, I think it is a definite buy. Heck, this is cheaper than most of the regular TVs being offered in the market right now. Do factor in the cost of getting 3D glasses (another 100-150 bucks) if you want 3D.Update: Mitsubishi has decided to stop manufacturing these TVs, so these will be the last iteration of DLP tvs from Mitsubishi. They have still promised to continue customer support for the currently sold TVs.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Amazing
Reviews.Author: Bradley
Reviews.Content: This is my first review i've ever took the time to post on Amazon. I've ordered many products on here, but this TV is so amazing that I had to put a review up. First things first, the TV is huge. I got the 73" model and i'm glad I didn't go any higher lol. I'm blown away by the price and features of this TV. The picture looks great out-of-the-box but once its properly calibrated, you would be hard pressed to find a better looking TV at this price and size.  The 3D is fantastic and i've compared this TV to other sets, and 3D for some reason looks best on DLP. There is no cross-talk whatsoever, and it creates a truly immersive experience. I've tested some pixar movies and 360/ps3 games. The 2D picture is fantastic and I was surprised at just how many settings you can adjust to really get the picture quality to your liking. DLP seems to fit right in the middle between plasma and led. You get a bright and sharp picture, while also having no ghosting at all when your wathing/playing fast moving scenes and video games.  Games that I have tested range from Halo 4, all the way to uncharted 3. I am blown away at just how well this TV handles everything that you throw at it. The Dark Knight Rises looks fantastic on this TV, as well as many other Blu-ray titles. I'm also quite impressed with how deep the black levels are for this TV. If you have the TV in a proper home theater room with little to no ambient light, than your in for a treat.  This TV also features Apps such as Vudu, Facebook, Twitter, and much much more. There isn't as many apps here as there are in other brands, but that's not the main reason you should be buying a TV. What is here though works great, and many more apps will be available in the near-future. I can't recommend this TV enough, and if your wanting a giant TV at a good price with lots of feature, DLP is the way-to-go.  I hope this review helps everyone out and if your on the fence, don't be. This is an amazing TV that is just as good, if not better than plasma and led. My TV arrived in about 5 days and the delivery guys were excellent. They took the TV upstairs, checked and made sure it worked, and then took away the packaging and debris.  My TV was from Paul's TV, but was fulfilled by Amazon. I have had zero problems with this TV, and will definitely not hesitate when buying again in the future. I wish you the best of luck, and I hope you enjoy yours, as much as I have mine so far. Thank you for taking the time to read my review and I hope I have helped you in some way.--Brad

Reviews.Title: DLP IS NOT OUTDATED!!
Reviews.Author: Klown
Reviews.Content: This television has everything those fancy expensive televisions have EXCEPT the slim size. Im so glad I bought this televsion for my Man Cave. ITS HUGE. The 3D is PERFECT and AWESOME. I'm glad Mitsubishi has chosen not to discontinue DLP's and even more glad that the television can still have the same TECHNOLOGY! Geez, I bet they could make a tube television have it all as well. I'm a CNET junkie, and an avid electronic person. If you wanna be hip and hang a television on your wall buy an LG LED 55inch for $1600. If you want a 73 inch that does the same dang thing and don't mind looking at it from ground level like back in'94 for $1200 then DUH. GO BIG OR GO HOME! Excellent DLP with no complaints. I just spent 8 hours playing BLACK OPS II in 3D, how awesome.  There aren't any flaws to this TV cept that its about 9 inches deep on the bottom and is on a tv stand. BOO WHO. I LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: EXCEPTIONAL TV... I had a 65 inch LED... this is BETTER/GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I had a great 65 inch thin LED tv... this is so much better... I was able to sell my used TV for more then the cost of the 82 inch.... and i have never been happier...the picture is sooo clear... I would recommend this TV to anyone with space enough to fit this beast!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture and price
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 82742 from Paul's TV and I am astonished by the TV and Paul's service.  I had only seen the TV at HHGregg and the picture was not great.  A friend purchased one of the Mitsubishi DLPs last year and raved about the picture, but he is in another state and I never saw the TV.  I decided to take my friend and the Paul's TV rep at their word and they did not steer me wrong.Out of the box the picture was amazing.  Much better than my 2 year-old 50" Samsung Plasma and of course the size is much better.  The features of the TV are not great, but they are sufficient.  For inputs there are three HDMI, one component/composite, coax/ant, 3.5mm audio, L/R audio, Ethernet, and one USB.  The USB is in the back of the TV and while that is convenient for a wireless dongle, it is inconvenient for firmware upgrades or using a keyboard/mouse for VNC (I have not tested the VNC function).  Outputs are very limited and include a coaxial digital audio and 3D emitter.There are four picture modes with Brilliant, Game, Bright, and Natural.  The internet apps are limited to Vudu and Vudu apps.  I find it strange that Mitsubishi would be so limited when most internet enabled TVs include Vudu, Netflix, and Amazon streaming.  The most puzzling aspect is that the TV supports picture-in-picture in Vudu app mode and with VNC, but not for anything else.  An 82" TV would be great for PiP football games.What I don't like about the TV1. Limited input/output, especially the lack of TOSLink for audio.2. No ability to turn off automatic HDMI input sensing3. Lack of internet apps.  Vudu is okay, but when practically every TV includes other streaming choices Mitsubishi should do the same.4. I would like to see more picture modes, but four is sufficient.5. Power on is very slow and the picture is dark for the first few minutes.  The slow on makes activity based remote control difficult.6. Can't hang it on a wall.  I need room for my Blu-Ray, AV Receiver, Satellite Box, and Media Center, so this is not a big deal.What I like about the TV1. The picture.  The picture is much better than I imagined.  It is bright, sharp and immersive.2. The size.  My wife already asked me when we can upgrade to the 92".3. I am not a big 3D fan, but the 3D on this TV is simply amazing.4. The viewing angle.  No problems seeing the TV from the side.When my neighbors and friends come over the TV wows them with the picture quality and size.  It is truly jaw dropping and their first questions are "where did you get it and how much did it cost".The customer service at Paul's TV is excellent.  There was a small problem with the local delivery company and Paul's did everything in their power to make it right.  I have always been impressed with Amazon's customer service and Paul's TV is as good if not better.  From their sales staff to customer service, they are a 5-star company.  I would not hesitate to recommend them or buy from them in the future.Finding a stand for this size TV was difficult.  I wanted to use the IKEA Besta line of modular furniture, but it was not deep enough.  I purchased the Tvilum Lauren stand from Amazon Tvilum Lauren 7954261 TV Stand, Black and Woodgrain and it is a perfect fit.  You can leave the doors off the stand if you need more room for AV components.  The stand is sturdy and I left the door handles off for a smoother look.Additional recommendations:Purchase a LED light kit Ledwholesalers 16.4 Ft RGB Color Changing Kit with LED Flexible Strip, 44 Button Do It Yourself Controller + Remote and Power Supply, 2034rgb Kit to go on the back of the TV.  It makes a big difference when watching movies at night.  The kit lets you mix colors to your liking and save the colors on the remote.  We typically use a white or blue depending on the movie and mood.Purchase a calibration DVD/Blu-Ray like Disney's World of Wonder Wow: World of Wonder [Blu-ray] to get an even better picture.

Reviews.Title: like it more than my LED
Reviews.Author: JONI Johnston "4 Z's mom"
Reviews.Content: my first review on Amazon (payback for all the help I've received).  Lots a good info out there already, I'll add:- great picture... and love the extra size.- like the quality of the picture better then the Pan LED we have... more like a movie... probably because it's projected... still super-sharp, just a little more like a movie- 18 inch depth a complete non-issue for us... we have the space... not that heavy... easy to move around- plenty bright... very bright room... lots of windows... no problem (can't tell diff between Pan LED in other room)

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!! w/ WARNING - not sturdy!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Shaundell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought this TV 2yrs ago from Kens Audio store in our home town so this review is VERY late, but I felt the need to still write one. First off this TV has everything you'll ever need - Bluetooth streming, internet, tons of inputs, 3D READY (you have to purchase the glasses separatly), and the picture quality is TOP NOTCH!!!! The internal 16 speakers are ok, but you'll still need to get a surround sound system or buy the Yamaha Sound Bar with subwoofer input (you will not be disappointed). Like a previous reviewer said, the TV takes some time to warm up and the TV IS NOT very sturdy so PLEASE sit on the floor or on a STABLE stand. We had ours on a TV stand and it gave way and the TV fell face first in the middle of the night. Waking up and seeing that f**** up our weekend. The TV was ruined.....the entire glass screen inside the TV was completly shattered and it only fell from a height of 1 or 2 ft. (MAYBE). So be mindful!!! I believe its safe to say that if this TV falls at all you could severly damage it so make sure you sit it in a spot away from foot traffic. BUT this isnt a deal breaker, just take care of it. We replaced our TV with another model, but it doesnt have the 16 speaker, Streaming , or Bluetooth (Base Model)....Kinda Sucks but we didnt really use those features anyway :(. One other thing I like about this TV is if it ever dies all you have to do is buy another bulb and BAMMM; brand new again. You cant say that about flat panel TV's and I have them all; if they die you might as well throw it in the trash. All in all thie TV is flawless, if you're the type of person you takes pride in your things you'll have no problem and you'll LOVE this TV just like we do. MAKE SURE YOU PURCHACE A WARRENTY if its available because it covers 1 (one) replacement bulb plus any damage to the TV not cause by misuse on your part.

Reviews.Author: Rexbo
Reviews.Content: Wanted a Mitsubishi big screen since the 90's. The picture is great. Easy set up. On screen programming is simple to follow. Picture was perfect right out of the box. Does more than expected. Beautiful colors. 3D is outrageous!  Totally satisfied.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: abissues
Reviews.Content: This beast of a tv is amazing and or the price I paid of only 1358, it cannot be beat. The picture quality is amazing, Internet works great, and combined with my 7.1 system, this tv gives a true theater experience. I cannot wait to try the 3d!

Reviews.Title: Great TV if you know what you're getting
Reviews.Author: Ben NYC
Reviews.Content: PROS:- Largest screen size for the money. A similar size LED TV costs upwards of $2,000- Excellent picture quality. Nice deep blacks, rich colors- No input lag for gaming.- 3D is great, both for movies and 3D gaming. I would recommend Activeshutter glasses over DLP-link glasses. The Playstation 3D glasses are perfectly compatible with this set and currently the cheapest Activeshutter 3D glasses you can getCONS:- Imperfect geometry, which is just one of the limitations of this technology. You can perform manual geometry adjustment using service mode but it only goes so far. With real-world TV watching this shouldn't matter much, but be aware that the "pin cushion" effect will still be noticeable whenever a grid or checkerboard pattern is displayed on the screen- Smart TV features are next to useless. Don't bother getting the wireless adapter for this TV because the only "smart" feature that it has is Vudu. If you need Netflix or Hulu, just get a Roku or PS3 or HTPC to hook up to this TV.- TV cabinet itself is a beast, and requires adequate clearance in the rear to prevent overheating- Be prepared to replace the bulb at least once approximately every 4 years. Absolutely get the Squaretrade warranty to cover the cost of a bulb replacement

Reviews.Title: Great Quality.
Reviews.Author: Dillon Smith
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed with this TV. The picture quality is outstanding, and the stock speakers are great. I would highly recommend this to anyone who is in consideration of a giant TV.

Reviews.Title: Grandkids Loving it
Reviews.Author: Grandma Perreault
Reviews.Content: I saw the TV and wanted the 92' 3D, i read up on the brand and decided it was what i wanted, ordering was easy, tracking was nice i received emails as to the status, the guys delivering the TV were very helpful and actually did not mind up inspecting the TV prior to signing for the TV, the TV was in excellent shape.  hookup was easy the best thing of all the picture and sound is great, love the TV my grand kids love the 3D, and the fact that you can sit anywhere and see the picture is even better no more fighting over who was sitting where lol.  This was our Christmas gift and we have no regrets.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: Delta_Kilo
Reviews.Content: I was concerned when we ordered this because it is going to sit on top of our fireplace.  Now our fire place is an electric so I have about 3 ft of space on top of the fire place.  The top of the fireplace is about 5' off the ground.  My couch sits about 12' away from the fire place and when sitting on the couch your head is about 1' below the top of the mantle.  The TV sits on top of this and I was worried the viewing angle would be to far off and not look good.  It actually didn't look bad.  But I cheated and leaned the TV forward buy placing a piece of wood that is 1" think under the back of the TV.  It wasn't going to fall over but I also anchored the back of the TV to the wall just to make sure.  Picture looks amazing and no viewing issues now while sitting.  It looks great while standing and at the sides around 45 degree angle.  For the price I couldn't be happier.  I was worried about the bulbs as I have heard they are really expensive but Amazon sells them for around $54 and from what I'm reading the bulb should last over a year to possibly 2.  I'm fine with paying that ever year or so.  I replaced a 50" plasma and it's sound was horrible.  Because of the larger base of the DLP it's sound is great for a TV.  I have had the TV for about 2 weeks.  I had read about white spots appearing on the screen after a year or so.  I bought a 4 year warranty you can purchase at the time you buy the TV.  Hopefully I wont need it but if I do I'm covered.  I'm extremely happy with the picture and compared to my 720P Plasma the picture it's very close to it, but I'd pick this TV hands down over my plasma because of the size and sound.  Plus it's 3D and that looks amazing as well.  Very happy over all and have a few friends who have come over and seen it and couldn't believe a projection TV could look like this and will be ordering one soon.

Reviews.Title: Enjoy it while it lasts
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Ive had this 73 for a few months now, picture is incredible, 3D is a nice feature, sound is good. However I have a few issues with it. After only a couple months its making that really annoying ringing sound that I used to get on a really old tube tv that you would have to tap the side of it to get it to make it stop.. Also it makes a strange screaching noise when powering on. It also occasionally shuts off on its own, this has only happened a handful of times so far. So I guess you get what you pay for. I would say its cheaply made, which is why its so inexpensive compared to all other tvs this size.

Reviews.Title: MITSUBISHI 92 INCH IMAX JUMBOTRON: THE 747 JUMBOJET FLAGSHIP OF REAR PROJECTION HDTV's "THE BIG BOSS"
Reviews.Author: VECTORPLEX
Reviews.Content: All I can say about this Mitsubishi 92 Inch Mammoth IMAX Jumbotron 3D HDTV is "WOW". When it first arrived at my house, I was completely blown away at the size of this behemoth. I had never seen this TV physically in person, except for online and on Youtube.com. I had a general idea of how large this TV was as I took the proper measurements, but when I got it inside my house, it looked even larger than I had expected, more like a 102 inch. I have myself an instant Movie Theater. Immediately, I got that huge monster all hooked up and calibrated to it's maximum ability and it was on. I watched movie after movie, then watched a NBA Basketball game. The picture quality on this TV is so sharp, it is like having a ring side seat. Before I purchased the massive Mitsubishi 92 Inch, I watched my Movies and Sports on a JVC 56 Inch Rear Projection HDTV, which still plays very well for a 5 year old HDTV. I plan to give my JVC 56 Inch to my parents as a Christmas Gift, now that I have my Mitsubishi 92 Inch Mammoth Jumbotron. If you are looking for a larger than life movie theater experience, this is the TV that you want to own.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs...
Reviews.Author: Richard E Hart
Reviews.Content: I have a dark basement with no windows in the room I placed the 73742 so I've got zero problems with outside light washing out my image.  And the image is great -- had to tweak it away form default settings, but no worries -- 73 inches of splendor.  I've been a projector guy the last two upgrades so... the past 10 years, and in my new house I really wasn't up for running wire for a new ceiling mounted projector (old one sold with my old house), so I decided to give rear projection a try, and I'm not disappointed.  Just a reminder, this unit is rather deep, so be sure if you plan to place your center channel speaker (or sound bar) in front of the television upon the same surface that the TV is resting on, that your TV stand is deep enough to accommodate both.  Currently my center channel is sitting on the floor until my new stand arrives... eventually.  Also, if you plan to use the wifi portion of this TV (I did not, I interface with an Apple TV and a PS3) that you get the recommended wifi adapter (which is sold separately for about 40 bucks).Probably the only thing I didn't like is that I wish the unit felt a little sturdier, but I guess it is essentially just a projector screen housed by a plastic shell.  It could be a little more sturdy though, so handle with care while moving it :)

Reviews.Title: great tv but be careful of warranty when purchased through amazon
Reviews.Author: E. Tucker
Reviews.Content: I don't own this TV because it wouldn't fit in my house but boy would I love it to.  I was able to experience the beauty in person at a family member's house and trust me, it is as amazing as it looks in the pictures.  Two things to watch out for though. One - get a sound system.  If you are spending this money on a TV, don't settle for crappy built in speakers.  That's like buying a porsche and putting water in the gas tank (okay bad analogy) but you get what I mean.  Two - watch where you are ordering it from.  Be sure on the main product page below, it says that it is shipped from and sold by amazon.com.  If it isn't, then it will most likely not be an authorized dealer and it won't carry the manufacturer warranty.  Doing that, is like buying a porsche and not... eh. nevermind.  You get what I mean.http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B007TGKLFM/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&camp;=1789&creative;=390957&creativeASIN;=B007TGKLFM&linkCode;=as2&tag;=stupisms-20

Reviews.Title: Very impressive
Reviews.Author: W. TAYLOR
Reviews.Content: This is my third Mitsubishi DLP tv. The size makes the living room feel like a theater. I have a stand for my reciever Xbox PS3 that I place the tv on so I didn't need to hang it on a wall. If you don't need to hang it you can save over $2000 compared to a LED LCD. The 3D works quite well. Brightness and color and contrast are non issue. I realize now that the 3D sources have to be connected directly to tv for 3D to work. So the TV could use more than the 3 HDMI connections. Pauls delivery was great. They wouldn't even take a tip after unboxing and setting up.

Reviews.Title: 82 inch tv
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Pinette
Reviews.Content: Pros-Huge screen great gamingCons- Needs hd hook up or you will only get 480 picture. Intetnet not very good pretty much just voodoo and have to buy the adapater for that,customer service,3d need set up cost hundreds.Overall nice tv but after pay 1,700 for the tv 225 stand, 275 3d glasses (4 pairs), 50 Internet usb adp.,180 waranty. Close to 2,500 for the set up.

Reviews.Title: Great for games and movies, not so great for computers
Reviews.Author: krohgster
Reviews.Content: I waited to review this TV until I had my first major problem with it. My review is based on several factors; features, quality, ease of use, ease of setup, Mitsubishi's warranty, and the repair service.First of all, let me share my setup so people can understand my usage and experience. I have my gaming computer, ps3, xbox 360, and onkyo 7.1 surround sound system hooked up to it. I use the TV for 5 to 15 hours a day, depending on whether it is a weekday or weekend. Most of my usage is with my computer and the rest is shared equally between my xbox and ps3. I use the TV to play video games, watch hd streaming video, surf the web, edit pictures with photoshop, watch 3D bluray's, etc.Below I will highlight the pros and cons for each of the uses and systems I use the TV for to help provide you with a well rounded picture of the TV.------------------------------XBOX 360 & PS3------------------------------Pros  * Beautiful gaming experience when sitting down  * Slight loss of brightness when standing up and playing with a camera input such as a Kinect  * Regular Blurays play beautifully  * The picture fills the entire screenCons  * 3D Blurays are difficult to watch because of the low refresh rate------------------------------Computer------------------------------Pros  * HD movies and video games are absolutely beautifulCons  * This TV is unable to show the full 1080P desktop while using the entire screen. You have to choose between two formats; either you lose all of the edges of your desktop in order to use the entire screen, or you lose several inches off your TV in order to display the entire desktop. In other words, if you want the entire desktop to show up, you essentially have a 69" TV instead of a 73" TV. If you don't mind losing the edges of your desktop (including most of the menu bar), then you can have 73" of screen space.  * Because it is such a large screen, text is extremely small and blurry, making it difficult to read. I have to zoom in to websites at 175% just to be able to read text. Unfortunately, not everything can zoom in, so when I use Photoshop or other applications, I have to sit uncomfortably close to the TV or squint to try to read the button/menu text.------------------------------The TV Itself------------------------------Pros  * The size!  * Absolutely no pixilation or blur with fast movement  * Very easy to set up, it auto detects whenever you plug a device into the HDMI ports  * The display and colors are fully customizable, allowing you to tweak the colors to your preferences for each device  * There is no burn in, so you can switch between a computer and ps3/xbox without issues  * Extremely bright! I have three large windows in my living room, and even on the normal brightness I can see the TV just fine  * No visible frame rate lag with video games and HD movies  * Everyone who comes to my house says it's just like going to the moviesCons  * You can see the "pixels" when viewing white or other bright colors  * When watching 3D the motion is not smooth, making it difficult to keep watching  * It has an obvious narrow sweet spot where everything is brighter; however the visible range is wide  * The screen is shiny, so light reflects off it  * The TV comes with a standard remote control without a keyboard------------------------------Warranty------------------------------Two months after I bought the TV, I noticed that the screen would intermittently flicker. After another two weeks, the flickering became almost constant, so I called Mitsubishi. The Mitsubishi representative was very helpful and scheduled a service appointment for me within a few days. However, when I called the service company, they said they deleted my appointment out of their system because I lived too far away. Long story short, if you live in a rural area, make sure you call Mitsubishi and request a service update daily. It took them 10 days to finally schedule the appointment, which was scheduled another 7 days away. So, 17 days after I first called, the repair technician came to fix my TV.Unfortunately, that did not fix my TV and it took 3 more months and 2 additional service calls for them to fail to fix my TV. Finally, after 4 months of frustration on my part, I read an Amazon review of someone who had the same issue. He solved the flickering issue by purchasing a high-end power conditioner (Belkin PureAV Home Theater Power Console -Black). I bought it and sure enough, the flickering is gone! Why neither Mitsubishi nor the repair company suggested this still stumps me to this day.One thing I have to make clear; even though Mitsubishi and the repair company were unable to fix the problem, Mitsubishi stood behind their product.------------------------------Summary------------------------------I am very happy with this TV, even with all of the con's I listed. I would recommend purchasing an extended warranty with this TV because of all of the issues people have with Mitsubishi TVs. If you are looking for a big screen for your computer, there are better options out there. If you are looking for a big screen for gaming and/or HD movies, then this is for you!

Reviews.Title: This is HUGE!!!
Reviews.Author: karen szabo
Reviews.Content: We replaced a 14 year Mitsubishi 60" TV with this 92" monster and all I can say is WOW!!!  It has the best picture with the High Definition.  We found a gorgeous stand at "Haverty's" that matches other pieces in our house.  Everyone is so impressed with the picture and are planning on purchasing one themselves.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Walking in Memphis
Reviews.Content: If there is one word that could describe this TV, it would be "AWESOME!" This is a huge, very high quality TV, especially for the prize!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I'm loving mine.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: RodneyPaul "rpm"
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv set up for only a couple of weeks now so I haven't played with all the settings, but just have been very pleased with the picture quality. I have it hooked up to my PS3 and an antenna (I get about 10 stations in HD via an antenna in my attic). I stream media via the PS3 from Amazon and it looks outstanding. Obviously, due to the sheer size of this screen, the better the source the better it makes the tv look. I want to try out the USB port for playing vids off of a hard drive...but have been busy doing other things.So for now...very happy with the picture, yet to try 3D and other features.

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever
Reviews.Author: Robert Meyer
Reviews.Content: This is the best TV I've ever owned, without a doubt. The price is unbelieveable for the size of the screen - I got the 73 inch because I thought anything 80 or higher would be a little too big for my room and what I would want. I had been looking at 65 - 70 inch tvs at bestbuy, walmart, etc but all 70 inchers were at least $3k. I have one room that looks great with a TV on the wall but I have a giant window in the way in my other room so hanging up on a wall was not even an option for the most part. If you don't mind it being a little bigger in terms of space then this should be a no-brainer. I had a DLP in 2006 that crapped out on me after 4 years or so, so I went ahead and got the waranty just in case.Have not really messed with the 3D function yet so I can't comment but honestly I could care less, I just wanted the biggest TV I can get for my money.If I had a complaint I would say the connections in the back...no regular RCA outputs to hook up to a surround sound so I've been listening through the standard speakers which aren't awful but I would like to have the option...I'll have to figure out how to use the only output I see. 3 hdmi is fine, no vga to connect to a computer but my girl has a mac mini which uses an hdmi so no worries there.go buy this tv you will be happy

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: SFKent21
Reviews.Content: Although, it may not be the sturdiest of TVs, and it is a projection TV... for the price and size. I give it 5 stars.When trying to move it I heard so excessive creaking, that almost sounded like cracking. No damage was done that I am aware of, by moving this unit is not a one person task.

Reviews.Title: Good enough for me!
Reviews.Author: Paul H. Kim "ptothekay"
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't really consider myself an audio visual snob, but I definitely take time to do my research before buying most AV equipment (I'll admit, I've purchase some speakers/subs off of Craigslist, sight unseen or heard, for that matter).  I'm glad I pulled the trigger on this TV when I did as the price went up $200 the day after I bought this set from Paul's TV.  (I paid $1799 - shipped).The picture is stunning, and big....really big.  The funny thing is, I paid $2000 for a Hitachi 42" HDTV CRT projector back in 2000, then upgraded in 2006 to a Hitachi 55" LCD projector for $2000, now I've got this behemoth 82" DLP, that fits perfectly and has a really really beautiful picture, and I paid $200 less than those other TVs.  I've currently got it set to 'Natural' mode, without any additional tweaking.  I am thinking about further calibrating, but I'm pretty happy with how things look for now.  I have the audio playing via 7.1 AVR, so the sound quality of the internal TV speakers is not a factor for me.  I would strongly suggest using this TV in conjunction with a surround sound system to complete the true cinema effect.Like other people said in previous posts, there is a bit of glare on the screen during the day as I have this TV in a well lit room with a lot of windows, but it's completely acceptable (to me).  I'm just really really happy to have purchased this TV.

Reviews.Title: Mitsubishi 82-742 Quick Review
Reviews.Author: Accidental_Genius
Reviews.Content: Pros==========Price for large screen(1/3 cost compared to LED sets)super performance for night time viewingCons==========internet apps are useless(if I had to buy again..I would get the 642 model)daytime viewing is not that greatSome observations==================Remember to use high speed hdmi cables.  There seems to be a handshake issue with other types of cables.Picture out of box is very good(natural mode).  To get a great picture, need to calibrate the TV.Haven't tried 3D yet.

Reviews.Title: WOW what a view
Reviews.Author: Sunflower "Daisy"
Reviews.Content: We're REALLY enjoying this HUGE TV.  Outstanding picture quality, but can be a little grainy at times trying to 'catch up' on fast moving shots, I hear that is due to the mhz portion...not really a bother unless you know to look for it.  The only real drawback is that the TV is projection and cannot be wall mounted.  HOWEVER, no problem there, bought a nice new entertainment stand for our TV and was able to get rid of the hideous shelves attached to the wall that my future husband thought were "practical".  It's a win-win for both of us, LOL!

Reviews.Title: Didn't know what I was missing
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Berg
Reviews.Content: We've been through a few TV's lately.  We took back our first LED HD flat screen TV because I hated the photoshopped looking picture. We got a different brand, a 47-inch, that we have been happy with, but, honestly, until we got our new Mitsubishi, I was just as happy to watch our 12-year old 65" projection TV that we keep upstairs.  Well, my husband decided he wanted to take our flat screen to the office and get a bigger one for our family room.  I thought it was extravagant, but I am glad he talked me into it.  We chose the 72-inch and I was blown away by the beautiful picture.  I am not an expert on picture quality, by any means, but I can tell you that this picture is just so pleasing.  The old TV upstairs isn't so great anymore.  In my opinion, many of the new TV's have a harsh picture.  Not so with this one.  I can see the pores in faces and yet the picture is soft and natural. We have ordered the 3D glasses and I will update this review once we have tried the 3D experience.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Stunning
Reviews.Author: Wykked
Reviews.Content: Purchased a 92inch TV at Aaron's.  Gorgeous Picture, well worth the money for a fraction of the cost of LED TVs.  We have it on a stand in our livingroom it takes up almost all of one wall. Great show piece especially if you are a movie or gaming person. I would definately recommend this mitsubishi.  Only con feature is the wireless device only offers one USB choice, or hardwired,but once you overcome that issue its all uphill. We play Xbox bowling, dancing as well as Black Ops II in stunning color. Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: 82 inch Mitsubishi  3D television
Reviews.Author: micheleaustera
Reviews.Content: The picture is wonderful!  I don't know how I ever lived without this television.  It's like having a theater in my own living room.  The seller delivered within less than a week.  the price was outstanding and the delivery service was polite, caring and made sure that everything worked on delivery.  Only issue is that the television did not come with 3D glasses, but considering the price I can't really complain.

Reviews.Title: Impressive
Reviews.Author: Francisco Hernandez
Reviews.Content: Overall rating is favorable.PROS: Great picture!CONS: The screen surface is reflective and susceptible to glare and could not get the the recommended wireless USB adapter to connect to the network.

Reviews.Title: 92" TV for Under $3K
Reviews.Author: Thomas A.
Reviews.Content: I like RoyalWalter got my 92" at Aaron's. I looked at the Sharpe 80" 240HTZ; but for $2K less I got a significantly bigger screen. I got mine For $2900 stand, tax and delivery included! I knew when Mitsubishi announced they would stop making these sets, they would both drop in price and disappear quick, which they did. I checked out every TV 80" and bigger for my home theater room, including several front projectors. Not only is the picture fantastic, both 2D and 3D. But you literally can not find anything close to this size for the $, they just don't exist! I highly doubt there are any new 92s still in boxes, but I do know there are a few scattered 80s around that can be had for under $2500, if you're looking for a BIG screen, with a great picture, at a great price GRAB ONE! Mine is now 7 months old, it gets used about 3-4 hours a day; and the set is still performing at the same great level as when I first calibrated it!

Reviews.Title: Love It...Affordable.. Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Craig Reeves
Reviews.Content: Ive always been looking for the next best thing for TV's in my home. Ive owned many different sizes and styles of TV.. I bought projectors and flat screens, LCD and then this monster.I actually went in to buy the 70" version and after seeing this and for the little amount more it was totally with it.  What got me was I bought a 47" TV years ago and thought it was the best thing ever (720P).. then I saw commercials with these being sold and they showed that the 82" is actually 3 47" TV's turned vertical. I was sold...The one thing you have to tai into consideration is a base or stand. I already had one that would hold a 60: TV but the good thing is the base of this TV is not as big as the TV so my stand works perfect.  Being a DLP it's naturally not a wall hanging TV but surprisingly is not that deep either so it will fit nicely in the corner of your room.The picture is clear, the functions work great.  the only thing we have any issues is every once a while it won't turn on.  The power button flashes for like a minute and then stops .. then it will turn on.. not sure what it is but it hasn't affected my opinion on the TV.Even with it's size it's not especially heavy but will defiantly take a couple people to move it.If the 92" wasn't so expensive when I bought this I would have considered it but the stand was to tall and wouldn't fit in my area I have this now.

Reviews.Title: The Best TV I ever have!
Reviews.Author: Pooh Bear "Learning mom"
Reviews.Content: I have this TV now for over a year from Amazon and absolutely love it. Mitsubishi makes excellent TV. My spouse and I bought last year as an add on to our family room. We have another 65" Mitsubishi diamond purchased in 2002 costing us twice as much and its still running good, currently placed in our play room, with  no issue at all. However, once this TV is set up, everyone in our household only like to watch on this TV. The pictures are clear and crisp, since our family room is always dark anyway. The black are true black - as far as picture is concern. There is a slight glare if we open up our blind, since its so close to the TV but its not that obvious. The only issues I have with this TV are 1. Finding a TV stand at a reasonable price, which took several months before we end up getting a deal. 2. It take a minutes for it to start when we try to turn on the TV. I'm believe the delay is due to all the internet, web TV, etc info that the TV have to retrieve. We have the same delay problem with another TV that have smart devices. The 65" Mitsubishi old dinosaurs doesn't seem to have this issue.We also bought extended warranty through Costco and it kicks in after the warranty expire from Mitsubishi, just for the piece of mind. I heard Mitsubishi discontinued their DLP line at the end of 2012. Hopefully, replacement parts are still available if needed.

Reviews.Title: Very limitted support for audio out for surround sound.
Reviews.Author: T. Brown
Reviews.Content: With a tv this size you would expect an owner to automatically bypass the tv speakers in favor of a surround system.  However, you an only use an Optical output if you want to do so.  Even cheaper televisions have a standard rca audio plug output for audio ... Not this one though.

Reviews.Title: I love it!!!
Reviews.Author: carlos martinez "carmar0125"
Reviews.Content: Bought this at a great price here on amazon. Im fortunate I bought it when I did because the price has rocketed back up. I love the size and the great quality of this tv. My only complaint is I wish they made this in a LCD LED at this size and price. Did I mention that I LOVE IT! I do!

Reviews.Title: 73 INCH TV
Reviews.Author: Steven H.
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. the box looked a little ripped around the bottom but the TV was in perfect shape and met all my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Extremely disappointed that Mitsubishi discontinued the DLP product line
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this TV.  I wish I could buy another.  It's sad to see a quality product line go away.

Reviews.Title: Great big TV
Reviews.Author: ChozyCorleon
Reviews.Content: Love this big screen TV it works perfect and it came in right on time. Its not as heavy as it looks.

Reviews.Title: Love the size and clear picture
Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: The size is just right for my living room.  The clear picture is nice and I haven't used the 3D part yet since my TV carrier doesn't have one program in 3D. I'd recommend this to anyone.  I watch in HD.

Reviews.Title: I Purchased this item
Reviews.Author: JONTE WARD
Reviews.Content: I purchased this mitsubshi wd- 73724 73-ich dlp hd tv at a great price with shipping cost included, the delivery is fast and the customers service is great. I would recommend this tv to my family and friends.Thanks for a great tv.

Reviews.Title: perfect in every way!
Reviews.Author: Robert Aguirre
Reviews.Content: from purchase, delivery and set up, this was perfect in every way. i'm very pleased and would highly recommend this tv and amazon!

Reviews.Title: Go with Walts!!!
Reviews.Author: David A. Dosreis "King David"
Reviews.Content: When looking at these TVs I looked at all reviews I could find. The TV it self is fantastic! I am a hockey fan and the ice looks good enough to make enveryone in the room feel cold while watching it. I have had no problems with the TV, knock on wood, and would recommend it to anyone who wants the screen size without breaking the bank on competitor TVs.2 Suggestions: 1. Get straps to ensure this TV doesn't fall over on your kids. The TV isn't wobbly or anythign but it is massive and very heavy!!! 2. These TVs are sold by WALTS and Pauls, go with WALTS!!! Not that I used Pauls but the reviews they have gotten are sketchy. I can tell you personally that WALTS was fantastic. They called to confirm the purchase within 30 minutes of it posting to Amazon and followed it daily with updates to let me know where my TV was and what to expect. They go through a very reliable freight service as well that took extremem care in ensuring the TV came to me just as it had come off the line moments before. Thank you to WALTS and thank you Amazon. What guy doesn't want to play Skyrim and Halo on a TV where a dragon is the size of your 85 lb. dog?

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Awesome picture quality. Had a few problems at first, but Paul's TV took care of them in a timely manor.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Jones1992
Reviews.Content: We love this TV. The picture quality is great as is the sound. We haven't tried out the 3D capabilities but hope to soon. The only problem we are having is connecting to any application such as Amazon Prime videos but it is more a technical user issue then product problem.

Reviews.Title: Great product. Recommend strongly over comparably priced LCDs.
Reviews.Author: Keith Lawler
Reviews.Content: Great product. Came quickly was ready to use right out of the box, The optional wifi dongle works well, however the streaming services available are still limited (want to use my amazon instant video with it).

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Eric Butler
Reviews.Content: Excellent tv for the money.  Size and picture quality can't be matched for the price I paid for this TV.  Sure there are better ones but for the money nothing even close.

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: fred
Reviews.Content: great t.v. sound not the best but picture is world class. Great watching sports , Gaming also. For the price this T.V. can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: I love these DLP'S
Reviews.Author: T. Witman
Reviews.Content: This is the second Mitsubishi DLP TV in my house.  The other one is a 65".  The colors and resolution are just remarkable.  The 3D works great too!  Of course, the price is right as well.  So they are deeper than flat screens but at only 14" deep, it's no problem putting it on a console, which is where I would want it anyway.On the drawback side, my TV was one of the last ones made by Mitsubishi!!!!  They stopped production so if you want one, you better hurry and get one!

Reviews.Title: WOW!!
Reviews.Author: M. Torres "Marco"
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW! I decided to buy this Home Cinema HDTV for our basement & once I turned it on, it was great! The setup was easy and everything I plugged into it was recognized right away. I read other reviews where you had to mess with the picture settings for a better picture, but honestly, it had a fantastic picture right out of the box. The only thing I had to do was make sure my satellite box was setup for 1080P ,set the screen size & that was it. I also connected a USB network receiver so I could connect to the Internet. This set comes with some great features for the Internet stuff for streaming movies & other things..I also read some reviews regarding the sound on this set saying it sounded tinny  & to be honest, it sounded great. I also changed the sound setting from stereo to surround & they both were great but opted for the surround, just my preference. The picture as I said was clear, crisp and sharp. all in all this was a great deal for the price & the picture and sound quality are outstanding.very satisfied!!

Reviews.Title: Enormous
Reviews.Author: AkROX!!!! ;)
Reviews.Content: If you like big, this is for you. I was in the market for projectors for my home theater, but after doing all the research, It quickly became clear that the technology is not quite there yet. But this behemoth is the perfect solution.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV For the Price
Reviews.Author: Matt from Hawaii
Reviews.Content: This TV is absolutely massive. On a typical TV Stand that I have, it gets within about a foot of my ceiling. The picture quality is great when watching movies and sports. I paired this TV with a Bose Acoustimass VI, an Onkyo Receiver and the result is my own movie theater for less than a 65' Aquos. This is definitely the way to go if you want to have a giant TV for a game at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality TV
Reviews.Author: Customer in Detroit
Reviews.Content: Great and clear picture quality and easy to use for Internet with adapter. It is a lil slow coming on, be cuz of projection, but not a major problem.

Reviews.Title: A great large HD TV.
Reviews.Author: T. Madison "Avid Jenna reader"
Reviews.Content: This HDTV is great and does 99% of everything we expected.  The HD picture is outstanding.  The only disappointment was in the Internet connection was restricted to on source (Vudu).  I was not the able to get access to Netflix or Amazon or anything else on the internet.  Everything else works fine and had the white glove delivery.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Limey Girl
Reviews.Content: Great picture.  Easy setup.  Fits the location I had in mind for it.  It replaces a Mitsubishi tv and I have always been satisfied with the quality of their produce.

Reviews.Title: Overall, the picture wasn't sharp, colors wasn't great, and had geometry issues. Think it was lemon.
Reviews.Author: M. Epstein
Reviews.Content: I've gone back and forth with my review of this TV.  It came shipped with severe pincushion issues which were fixed (to some extent) using geometric adjustments.  Once "fixed" I really wanted to love this TV.  In the end however, the picture lacked focus, or put another way wasn't sharp / was somewhat blurry.  When the screen was zoomed in on someone's face and the picture wasn't moving, everything looked pretty much 1080p.  But when watching action (i.e. sports), the picture became much fuzzier and had some ghosting effects.  On paper this TV was supposed to look great, and reading user reviews, you'd think it did.  But I had to constantly defend the TV to people watching who would notice it wasn't as sharp as their LED or LCD sets with "well it still has to be professionally calibrated" (these people would invariably ask: "but it's rear projection outdated technology?").  [As a side note I actually did calibrate picture and color using Disney's WOW, but the colors never looked correct regardless of setting, custom or among the 3 built-in settings (skin would either be overly orange, or without any natural tones).  Overall, I decided to return the TV despite how awkwardly large this unit is.  Given how horribly bad the geometry was when I received this unit, and how the picture seems fuzzy, I believe it must have been banged into during shipping and the mirrors became mis-alligned.  Now the price of the 82742 has increased beyond the point of the 842, so I'm going to try the 82842 and hopefully I get the properly-functioning unit that everyone else seems to be raving about.

Reviews.Title: Love our new TV
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this product.  Excellent picture for cost. Met all expectations.  A large TV stand is needed for this TV.

Reviews.Title: Stick with the new flat screens for a bit more money.
Reviews.Author: john tobias ludwig
Reviews.Content: Picture is okay. 3D glasses not included. Needs adapter also not included to connect to the internet for web features.

Reviews.Title: Halo looks great, sports look horrid
Reviews.Author: ipaesbale
Reviews.Content: I'm hoping for some feedback/suggestions on improving the picture quality (and I will change the rating if  it can be fixed).  I see others have commented that the stock settings could use some improvement.Positive - Halo looks great and the large screen size is great for split screen gaming (my primary motivation for going with this large tv) - HD movies look greatNegative- Sports look so bad, I can't stand to watch them on this tv.  There is ghosting around players.  This is primarily noticeable when the camera is zoomed out ... for example, when viewing the entire 3 point arc on basketball, there is a white border around all players.  When zoomed into only 1 or 2 players the white outline isn't noticeable.  Fast movement causes a very blurred image ... it looks very pixelated.  White colored objects seem to glow (no crisp lines surrounding white objects).My first thought was that the issue was the cable feed since HD movies and Halo looked great.  I do have a couple splitters and a fairly long cable run to the basement location where this set resides.  However, I tested using the ESPN app through XBOX and experienced the same issues as watching sports live.I have played with the picture settings (brightness, contrast, tint, etc.) ... but these don't seem to help.  This is in a basement with limited ambient light.  Any suggestions would be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!!
Reviews.Author: leemeade1977
Reviews.Content: This is a MUST HAVE for anyone who really enjoys movies and gaming. Picture is absolutely amazing. I couldn't be happier with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: THIS TELEVISION IS AWESOME!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Dominguez
Reviews.Content: It is amazing!!!!  The sheer size is absolutely astounding.  We had to have a television stand constructed from birch wood with 2x4 stabilizers for support.

Reviews.Title: We love it
Reviews.Author: prettybrneyes
Reviews.Content: We have owned since 2/11.  I will not give it a 5 because some channels are grainy sometimes, a tiny black spec appeared on the middle of the screen shortly after receiving, the adapter is not included and I was not told this (found out via research prior to purchasing).  I purchased from shopnbc and it included 4 pairs of 3d glasses, a blu ray player and a stand; tv is no longer available.  I love the large picture and 99% of the channels/movies we watch.  Everyone that visits me loves the tv.  It does occassionally shut down and thru research I've found that the back cover needs to be removed, along with some screws and the back needs to be vacuumed to remove dust to resolve the problem.  We haven't done this yet and it rarely happens and when it does we just turn it back on so it's not a problem.  It's hooked to a Comcast HD box so the picture is HD, mostly.  You can see every pimple on the screen on closeups which initially was disturbing, but now we're used to it.  I would purchase again and I would recommend.  I would probably purchase the version w/o 3D as I find 3D to be annoying and naseauting and we do not use that feature.  Apps were initially fun, but we never use them now.  You can run some items simulataneously but not all.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: MrBoo
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed with this TV. Also shocked at how light in weight it was. Picture quality is Great; An has a few features that can be turned On or Adjusted to your liking.  The only things I do not like about the TV are: Has no screen protector, No front inputs, and No picture in picture feature.  Overall,  a Good TV for a Great price.

Reviews.Title: When size does matter!
Reviews.Author: E. Lee
Reviews.Content: I bought the 840 series 92 in at a deeply discounted price. As has been pointed  out before it is a very large, heavy, bulky, OMG- inspiring piece of technology. Once the team of mules, oxen and Clydesdales hauled and positioned the behemoth in  my theater room, I proceeded to hook up all the peripherals( Blu-ray, satellite, surround sound, wi-fi). The unit has a generous amount of inputs to maximize the hi- definition and sound. Easy to set up ,good instructions and straight-forward remote. The picture is really quite good at an 8 to15 ft viewing distance. The screen is very reflective so you will need a dark room and the viewing angle is a bit restrictive, but not a bad trade-off for what you're getting. It does not come with 3-D glasses, but they are available on- line for less than $30 and work great with the built- in emitter. Overall, this is a very reasonable way to outfit a theater room without jeopardizing your child's college tuition. If you can find one for less than $2500, have the room and some big friends BUY THIS THING! You wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: Mitsubishi WD-92742 = outstanding
Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: Mitsubishi WD-92742. I have had this television for 5 months now and love it. First off, the sound is trash. If you are getting a 92 inch then the sound in the set will probably never be used, so no big deal.The picture will blow you away. Just plug it in and watch Dredd in 3d and then die happy. I really mean what I just said. Black ops 2 on a 360 will make you wonder why they are making a new Xbox.  I took several 360 games and replayed them. They all looked amazing and this television brought a whole new level of immersion.  Black ops 2 in 3D was an entire new game,  and with Portal 2 I just don't have the words.  I played Rocksmith with the HDMI going through the television then to the stereo and had no lag issues(that is good). I do wish it had more than three HDMI inputs though.Two problems with the television though. The bulb blew the first week, Mitsubishi had a new on in my hands in three days so props to them. The bulb was easy to change out. No problems with the new bulb. Second problem is that smaller televisions suck now, I tried to watch my buddies 60 inch and it just couldn't cut it. Not a problem but worth mentioning, have a nice stand ready, it needs to sit on a stand with plenty of room.In summary, nothing else will cut it after you experience this, and you will be happy with your purchase. It is called a cinema tv for a reason.

Reviews.Title: Mitsubishi HDTV
Reviews.Author: Judith A Herman
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a large screen TV.  This fit the agenda. Price and brand had a lot to do with my choice. Have been using it for about 3 weeks now, and no regrets.

Reviews.Title: WD-82742
Reviews.Author: Curt dog
Reviews.Content: I just got the Wd-82742 its the best tv i have ever had and its amazing. works great pirture sucks on sports scores without hd but with hd looks good for the money its great you cant go wrong with this tv

Reviews.Title: Arrived Damaged - Amazon 30 Day Support Useless
Reviews.Author: N. Gupta "iGeek"
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived a day late and damaged. The top edge of the screen was outside of the bezel. I was able to pop it back in. However, later I noticed a black mark on the screen about an inch long. My guess is that it's something on the projector because when I put a little pressure on the screen the mark does not move. I called Amazon's 30 Technical Support and their only solution was to schedule someone to pick it up and give me a refund.I was then put on hold. I have now been on hold for close to 30 minutes with Amazon customer service. This seems to be a fragile product couple with some pretty horrible customer service from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Massive screen size great picture quality
Reviews.Author: Tom Sawyer
Reviews.Content: Although I am very happy with the t.v Pauls dropped the price 100 dollars the next day and would not adjust the cost on my unit as far as the set goes the picture is awesome colors very sharp and has more features then I will ever use .There are not enough 3d pictures to justify buying a 3d set have only used it once and was very happy with the 3d quality.The set is huge so make sure you have the space for it as with all DLP sets this one is no different with glare back I have it in my theater room and it is pretty dark however if there is a light on or during the day the reflections will show in the screen.The biggest draw back is the speaker system it's terrible for this size if you do not have an external surround sound system get one as you will be wasting your time with the factory speakers I have mine hooked up to a JBL system and watched the Avengers to break the set in .Overall am very pleased with the amount of tv for the money it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: rusty
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv about one month and it is great- it is replacing a 62"samsung about 6years old- this tv is so much clearer. Only negative is broadcasts not in HD are a little less clear.

Reviews.Title: Not done yet.
Reviews.Author: hogbyte
Reviews.Content: The first television's remote stopped working. I had to wait two weeks for Mitsubishi to send a new remote. In the meantime, the bulb blew after having the set for less than two weeks. I got a refund from Amazon and purchased a new set. The second one was delivered this week. This one's screen was damaged, specifically not intact with the television. The delivery guys pushed it back in but the right side is separate from the edge. Whenever I get an error message from the cable company, a blue line appears down the right side. Now I have to order another television. Hopefully Paul's TV can get this one right.

Reviews.Title: todo ecelente
Reviews.Author: Alexander
Reviews.Content: gran tv bueno lindo para ver todo los re quicito para una tv 3d 3 hdmi colores ecelente para hogar

Reviews.Title: Mitsubishi 92 inch TV
Reviews.Author: arvee "moviemaker 1"
Reviews.Content: Massive TV arrived in good shape All I need to do is re do my surround system as I have an old 18 year sound System and need to redo for this with USB

Reviews.Title: thank you
Reviews.Author: Barbara Davis
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love our new tv.  We are purchasing more 3D glasses and movies to enjoy!  Thank you again! The Davis'

Reviews.Title: Black level is so disappointing during day time viewing
Reviews.Author: Vu T Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Just bought the WD-73742 set, everything look great during night time viewing but the black level is so disappointing during day time viewing, feel like a gray layer over the pictures. I have a portable DLP projector, a Samsung DLP LED RPTV, the Samsung bought back in 2008 and I believed it had the TI DARKCHIP 3 but the black level is much better than this Mitsubishi which supposed to have TI DARKCHIP 4 that should improve black level further. This Mitsubishi TV set have similar characteristic of my portable DLP projector during day time viewing, black become gray that loose lots of details on dark scenes. I think it is the screen material than setting (try lots of setting using AVIA DVD), the screen on Samsung set is much darker than Mitsubishi's. I hope someone can prove me wrong. 73740 owners, please comment on black level of your set during day time viewing.

Reviews.Title: Paul's TV  comes through, 5 Stars.
Reviews.Author: A. Brzozowski
Reviews.Content: I had some issues with delivery and Paul's TV has gone above and beyond to make amends.  5 Stars!The TV itself is well worth the money.  Best Picture.

Reviews.Title: Spots and lamp replacement
Reviews.Author: Truth
Reviews.Content: After 2 years you must replace the lamp after 4 years be prepared to buy a new one from all spots and dots that fill the sreen! Not willing to buy a t.v every 4 years no matter how good the price .

Reviews.Title: going back
Reviews.Author: godson2428
Reviews.Content: size is good but picture is not. had for a month  because i got used to the size but the picture for movies (transformers dark side of the moon) is not good at all. Football games are ok but not crisp.one upside is its good for mw3 and other video games but thats it.

Reviews.Title: I don't know how these things have a chance at arriving undamaged.
Reviews.Author: LakeHouse
Reviews.Content: Product had a great picture however the frame of the tv is so thin that it had bent and warped before it arrived. I will not be purchasing this item again. The packaging from Mitsubishi is a joke.  To get it to your home undamaged you would have to have much better packaging and a better product.  My LCDs have taken a hit with a tennis ball.  This tv would have fallen apart if touched.

Reviews.Title: It's Just OK
Reviews.Author: Ronald C Chivers
Reviews.Content: Picture is great but the TV lacks advanced features.  For example,  the sound (Audio) is marginal to say the least.  If it wasn't for my Bose 3-1 system it would be totally unsatisfactory.  If I had a choice I would not buy this set.

Reviews.Title: MITSUBISHI ELECTRIC WD92742
Reviews.Author: Bao Phan
Reviews.Content: Does anyone know the part number for the lamp, and where I can get a good price on a replacement lamp?Thanks in advancelinh811@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: Do not order this TV espicially from Pauls TV
Reviews.Author: deicer
Reviews.Content: I placed an order for this TV on Sept 30th, the TV was supposed to arrive Oct 4th, 2012.So on October 16th after not hearing anything from Paul's TV nor Home Direct USA (the company they use to ship their TV's) I decided to call Paul's TV and Home Direct USA.Pauls TV & Home Direct USA both stated they had no idea where the tv was at that time. They said it was somewhere on their loading dock and they would try to locate it.After explaining to the rep at Pauls TV (All customer service reps are very nice and they do a great job however they NEVER return your call when they say they will) I told them I would like to get a refund because this shipping error was not my problem and I was already frustrated with the entire situation. He told me I would have to pay $150 as a restocking fee and I would receive a refund once they get the TV back to their warehouse. I requested to speak to a supervisor or manager because I felt like this was totally unfair. After calling Pauls TV and Home Direct for a period of about 1 1/2 weeks they finally agreed to my request for a full refund BUT they told me that I would have to wait until the TV arrived back at their warehouse.One month later I finally got a full refund from Paul's TV / Amazon. I ended up calling Amazon because the TV and another item that I had purchased were no longer listed under my purchases for my account. They told me it was because I changed my account password, I'm sure that is pure b.s I am the kind of customer that is fair, I read reviews and I also write fair reviews for many other products 99% of them are positive. I will not be ordering with Pauls TV or Home Direct USA anytime in the future.Home Direct USA is worse than PaulsTV. They have several locations and are very difficult to reach.Home Direct USAPauls TV 1-888-728-5712Pick Up Address:450 REVOLUTIONARY DR.EAST TAUNTON, MA 02718Local Distribution Center:DIRECT EXPRESS FOR HDUSA,(317)838-5066p.s As for the product itself these TV's are cheaply made so do not let the sheer size of the tv fool you. Go for a good quality product even if it is a little smaller.

Stream TV Internet Media, 3DTV
iPhone/itouch/iPad remote control app
Built in 3D emitter
Advanced Video Calibration

ProductInfo.Name: Mitsubishi WD-92742 92-Inch 3D DLP Home Cinema HDTV (2012 Model)
